content: What famous American inventor, known for his work with electricity and the invention of the phonograph, has a nickname that means "The Wizard of Menlo Park"?

I believe the American inventor you're referring to is Thomas Alva Edison. He was indeed famous for his work with electricity and invented the phonograph, among many other inventions. The nickname "The Wizard of Menlo Park" was given to him because of his numerous innovations and the laboratory he established in Menlo Park, New Jersey. This lab was a research and development center where he and his team worked on various inventions, and it became famous for its high productivity and innovative spirit. So, yes, Thomas Edison is the one often called "The Wizard of Menlo Park."
